content:
• Monday, July 18, 2011
  • INTC

    Short sellers are positioning themselves around some big tech firms scheduled to release...

    Short sellers are positioning themselves around some big tech firms scheduled to release earnings this week, reports say. Short interest in Intel (INTC -0.4%) hit a level three times higher than at its last earnings report. Some other techs with heavy short interest also took it on the chin: YHOO -1.8%, JDSU -3.6%, CSCO -1%, AMD -3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • IBM

    In addition beating FQ2 estimates, IBM is slightly lifting its FY2011 non-GAAP EPS guidance to...

    In addition beating FQ2 estimates, IBM is slightly lifting its FY2011 non-GAAP EPS guidance to $13.25 from $13.15. The company's much-watched services division is reporting 10% annual sales growth, compared with 6% in FQ1; and IBM's services backlog stood at $144B as of 6/30, up slightly from $142B as of 3/31. Shares now +2.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • KKR

    Kohlberg Kravis (KKR -4.28%) is partnering with Munich Re to acquire a 49% stake in European...

    Kohlberg Kravis (KKR -4.28%) is partnering with Munich Re to acquire a 49% stake in European solar power generator Grupo T-Solar. This is KKR's second investment in European renewable energy over the past two months, as the sector continues to slump.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • BAC

    Some say Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) shares are oversold a day before Q2 results are out, but the...

    Some say Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) shares are oversold a day before Q2 results are out, but the stock was similarly oversold the last time it reported quarterly results; it fell 2.4% that day, and gapped even lower the next session. BofA -2.6% at $9.74, off a two-year low of $9.53 intraday (also). Financials (XLF -1.5%) lower across the board; European banks fare even worse.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • SMCI

    Super Micro Computer (SMCI -3.7%) continues lower after being downgraded earlier today at...

    Super Micro Computer (SMCI -3.7%) continues lower after being downgraded earlier today at ThinkEquity over near-term margin concerns due to higher inventories.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • CLX

    Clorox (CLX -2.1%) shares slip after investors take the weekend to digest Carl Icahn’s...

    Clorox (CLX -2.1%) shares slip after investors take the weekend to digest Carl Icahn’s $76.50/share proposal for the company. Bernstein Research sounds the alarm for investor caution, acknowledging downside risks if the deal falls apart, given "the real possibility that Icahn is not entirely serious, particularly if the board tries to negotiate aggressively." Shares now at ~$73.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • QLIK

    Shares of Qlik Technologies (QLIK +5.1%) recover nicely after Friday's steep loss on the heels...

    Shares of Qlik Technologies (QLIK +5.1%) recover nicely after Friday's steep loss on the heels of a Jefferies downgrade. Shares still trade below Jefferies' price target of $34.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM

  • Does the VIX still measure market fear accurately? That's the question some analysts are...

    Does the VIX still measure market fear accurately? That's the question some analysts are pondering after seeing a large growth in VIX-related products for investors eager to hedge risk. The VIX is +10% today on obvious market fears, but derivative traders say the VIXÂ hardly flinches unless major market news hits.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro (AMD -3.6%) is one of the big decliners among chip stocks, as ThinkEquity cuts...

    Advanced Micro (AMD -3.6%) is one of the big decliners among chip stocks, as ThinkEquity cuts its price target to $8 from $11, reflecting a softer demand outlook in the consumer PC market. But the firm continues to recommend buying AMD based on its new product ramps and "relative" health of the overall computing market. Also: SNDK -3%, MU -3.1%, TXN -1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • PRTK

    The fallout continues for Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT -7.6%) after the FDA's rejection of...

    The fallout continues for Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT -7.6%) after the FDA's rejection of its insomnia drug Intermezzo last week. The company announced plans over the weekend to slash its workforce by 45%, phasing out a number of "non-essential" positions in order to reduce operating expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • AUY

    Extorre Gold Mines (XG +6.9%) is one of several gold companies posting notable gains today as...

    Extorre Gold Mines (XG +6.9%) is one of several gold companies posting notable gains today as the yellow metal hits a new high. Gold ETF gainers: GDX +1.3%, GDXJ +1.4%, GLDX +1.7%, PSAU +1%, NUGT +2.8%, GGGG +1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • STJ

    Barclays expects defibrillator makers to feel the impact of lower procedure volumes in the U.S.,...

    Barclays expects defibrillator makers to feel the impact of lower procedure volumes in the U.S., where sales are under pressure after a negative study earlier this year. But it upgrades St. Jude (STJ +1.6%), saying shares should benefit as it takes market share. Medtronic (MDT -1.6%) and Boston Scientific (BSX -0.9%) are lowered, as the macro environment continues to inhibit growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • DB

    Europe's stress tests didn't adequately address key worst-case scenarios. According to Credit...

    Europe's stress tests didn't adequately address key worst-case scenarios. According to Credit Suisse, 27 European banks face a combined €82B shortfall in Tier 1 capital if Greek, Irish, Portuguese, Spanish and Italian government bonds are written down in line with market prices. (DB -4.2%), (CS -4.5%)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • AVNW

    Aviat Networks (AVNW +6.9%) pops after promoting Chief Sales Officer Michael Pangia to CEO, and...

    Aviat Networks (AVNW +6.9%) pops after promoting Chief Sales Officer Michael Pangia to CEO, and saying Q4 revenue will be near the high-end its range, between $115M to $120M, versus previous guidance of $105M to $120M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • GEOI

    GeoResources (GEOI -7.5%) gets hit after Baird cuts it to neutral on valuation. The firm said it...

    GeoResources (GEOI -7.5%) gets hit after Baird cuts it to neutral on valuation. The firm said it sees limited upside in the near-term until the company "further de-risks" its acreage in the Bakken and Eagle Ford shale.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT +6.5%) shares jump after shareholder Audley Capital urges the coal miner to...

    Walter Energy (WLT +6.5%) shares jump after shareholder Audley Capital urges the coal miner to explore a sale, since a "lack of strong leadership" had driven the company's valuation lower compared with its peers. The recent departure of the CEO and lack of a permanent CFO "has shaken investor confidence," Audley says in a letter to Walter's board.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • MSSR

    McCormick & Schmick's (MSSR +3.5%) is higher today, following Friday's announcement from...

    McCormick & Schmick's (MSSR +3.5%) is higher today, following Friday's announcement from Tilman Fertitta, owner of Landry's Restaurants, that he was terminating his $137M tender offer so he can participate in the latter company's sale process.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • END

    Endeavour (END -8.4%) trades lower after announcing earlier today it's acquiring the leasehold...

    Endeavour (END -8.4%) trades lower after announcing earlier today it's acquiring the leasehold and producing interests held by SM Energy (SM -2.4%) in the Marcellus shale in north central Pennsylvania, as well as a pipeline and related facilities for $110 million.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC -6%) dips after BofA Merrill Lynch cuts it to neutral, saying high financial...

    US Airways (LCC -6%) dips after BofA Merrill Lynch cuts it to neutral, saying high financial leverage and lack of hedging makes it the most sensitive to fuel prices among the legacy carriers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • TAOM

    The day before its quiet period ends, recent IPO Taomee (NYSE:TAOM) jumps +11.3%. After...

    The day before its quiet period ends, recent IPO Taomee (NYSE:TAOM) jumps +11.3%. After stumbling briefly out the gate during its debut, the stock has turned into a solid performer, gaining +50% over the past month.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • CHKP

    Shares of Check Point Software (CHKP +2.5%) reach a new 52-week high following its beat this...

    Shares of Check Point Software (CHKP +2.5%) reach a new 52-week high following its beat this morning. In a conference call with analysts, the firm's CEO said targeted cyber attacks are increasing security awareness, and issues upward guidance for Q3 and Q4.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • HEV

    Ener1 (HEV +26%) pops after receiving approval from the Chinese government for its joint venture...

    Ener1 (HEV +26%) pops after receiving approval from the Chinese government for its joint venture with Wanxiang Electric Vehicle to begin co-manufacturing lithium-ion energy storage systems for the China market.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • GPL

    Great Panther Silver (GPL +2.6%) moves higher after the company announces the acquisition of...

    Great Panther Silver (GPL +2.6%) moves higher after the company announces the acquisition of four mining concessions northeast of Guanajuato, Mexico. "This is a strategic acquisition for Great Panther," says CEO Robert Archer, "the concessions have excellent exploration potential."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • MTG

    Mortgage insurer MGIC (NYSE:MTG) is down 18.7% after reporting revenues and adjusted EPS of...

    Mortgage insurer MGIC (NYSE:MTG) is down 18.7% after reporting revenues and adjusted EPS of $367M and ($0.11), respectively. These numbers beat consensus estimates of $341.6M and ($0.11), but investors appear bothered by growing expenses related to defaulting mortgages. RDN -10.3% and PMI -10.2% in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • SVM

    Silver follows the same upward track as gold, topping $40/oz as a cheaper alternative to the...

    Silver follows the same upward track as gold, topping $40/oz as a cheaper alternative to the safe-haven favorite. Shares of select silver companies also gain: Silvercorp Metals (SVM +3.7%), Silver Standard (SSRI +1.8%), Silver Wheaton (SLW +2.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • MDW

    Midway Gold (MDW +5.6%) continues to rally, hitting a new 52-week high after announcing last...

    Midway Gold (MDW +5.6%) continues to rally, hitting a new 52-week high after announcing last week that it had discovered one of the longest and highest grade gold intercepts yet encountered at its Spring Valley, Nevada mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • IRE

    Shares of Bank of Ireland (IRE -12.9%) and Allied Irish Bank (AIB -11.9%) continue to seesaw...

    Shares of Bank of Ireland (IRE -12.9%) and Allied Irish Bank (AIB -11.9%) continue to seesaw dramatically as worries about European sovereign debt re-emerge again with a vengeance, and give back some of Friday's post-stress test gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 2 Comments
  • KATE

    Liz Claiborne (LIZ +5.8%) jumps on a report over the weekend that it's considering selling its...

    Liz Claiborne (LIZ +5.8%) jumps on a report over the weekend that it's considering selling its money-losing Mexx brand. Leonard Green & Partners, Sun Capital and Golden Gate Capital are among the firms exploring a possible purchase.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • SKYW

    Shares of SkyWest (SKYW -14.3%) fall sharply after the regional carrier issues downward guidance...

    Shares of SkyWest (SKYW -14.3%) fall sharply after the regional carrier issues downward guidance for FY11 profits. The firm also now sees a breakeven Q2 vs. consensus estimates of $0.25 EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • NABI

    Shares of Nabi Biopharmaceuticals (NABI -69.1%) plunge after results of clinical trials for its...

    Shares of Nabi Biopharmaceuticals (NABI -69.1%) plunge after results of clinical trials for its NicVax anti-smoking treatment showed it did not beat a placebo. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • AVGO

    Entropic (ENTR -11.4%) gets clobbered after Stifel Nicolaus cuts it to sell. Stifel says...

    Entropic (ENTR -11.4%) gets clobbered after Stifel Nicolaus cuts it to sell. Stifel says increased competition in the company's core market from Broadcom (BRCM -0.8%) and others will pressure its lead position, and result in "material" price declines for early generation MoCA chips starting in H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • PETS

    PetMed (PETS -4.4%) Q1 earnings fell 33% on lower sales and increased advertising expenses. The...

    PetMed (PETS -4.4%) Q1 earnings fell 33% on lower sales and increased advertising expenses. The company's 1-800-PetMeds phone line has posted double-digit profit declines over the past year as it struggles with a tight market for television advertising spots and cautious consumer spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is cut to sector perform at Pacific Crest on valuation. The firm says...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is cut to sector perform at Pacific Crest on valuation. The firm says overblown investor expectations have pushed the stock up nearly 60% this year, and recent subscription rate hikes may lead to slower growth. Shares -1.65% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • WLT

    Citigroup initiates Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) with a Buy rating, and a $144 price target. Shares...

    Citigroup initiates Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) with a Buy rating, and a $144 price target. Shares +5.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • HEV

    Premarket gainers: HEV +15%. WLT +7%. GSS +4%. GPL +3%. HL +3%.Losers: WBMD -19%. IRE -14%. MTG...

    Premarket gainers: HEV +15%. WLT +7%. GSS +4%. GPL +3%. HL +3%.
    Losers: WBMD -19%. IRE -14%. MTG -8%. ING -5%. NWS -4%. AIB -4%. LYG -4%. KOG -4%. ALU -4%. BCS -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • VLNCQ

    Valence Technology (VLNC) says Q1 sales will be between $13.5M to $14M, above previous guidance...

    Valence Technology (VLNC) says Q1 sales will be between $13.5M to $14M, above previous guidance of $8.5M to $10.5M. The boost is largely due to increased shipments to one customer, Smith Electric Vehicles. Shares +9.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • GCI

    More on Gannett (NYSE:GCI) earnings: "We also announced today that the board of directors has...

    More on Gannett (NYSE:GCI) earnings: "We also announced today that the board of directors has approved doubling the dividend and resuming share repurchases", said CEO Dubow. Shares +4.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • GCI

    Gannett (NYSE:GCI): Q2 EPS $0.58, beats by $0.01. Revenues were $1.33B, in line with estimates....

    Gannett (NYSE:GCI): Q2 EPS $0.58, beats by $0.01. Revenues were $1.33B, in line with estimates. Shares +4.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • WBMD

    WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) is preannouncing FQ2 revenues and EPS of $141M and $0.21 (excluding...

    WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) is preannouncing FQ2 revenues and EPS of $141M and $0.21 (excluding investment gains and discontinued operations), slightly below a consensus of $142.6M and $0.22. The company is also lowering its FY2011 revenue guidance to a range of $580M-$600M, compared with a prior range of $610M-$640M. Shares -17.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • MSFT

    JPMorgan downgrades LinkedIn (LNKD) to Neutral from Overweight on valuation, and maintains a $85...

    JPMorgan downgrades LinkedIn (LNKD) to Neutral from Overweight on valuation, and maintains a $85 price target. Shares -3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • NWS

    As the phone-hacking scandal continues to claim victims, investors drive News Corp.'s...

    As the phone-hacking scandal continues to claim victims, investors drive News Corp.'s (NASDAQ:NWS) shares down another 4.9% premarket. Analysts are less bearish, with Nomura's Michael Nathanson saying the company is still a Buy and that FQ4 earnings should still beat consensus estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • EDU

    New Oriental Education & Tech. Group (NYSE:EDU) posts higher Q4 profit on improved...

    New Oriental Education & Tech. Group (NYSE:EDU) posts higher Q4 profit on improved enrollment for its education services in China and strong margin results. Net income climbed 147% Y/Y to $14.4M from $5.8M. Shares +7.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG) says it's commencing an offering of 20M shares of common stock,...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG) says it's commencing an offering of 20M shares of common stock, with an overallotment option of another 3M shares. The proceeds will be used to repay debt, fund capex and for general corporate purposes. Shares -2.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 AM | 1 Comment
